required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Safe Return to Play Following Surgery for Labral Repair: Development and Validation of a Return to Play Checklist

brief_summary.textblock: This study will try to develop and determine objective and validated criteria for our athletes to safely return to sports after labral repair.

primary_outcome.measure: Successful completion of the return to play checklist
primary_outcome.description: This outcome measure will count the number of patients who meet all the criteria in the return to play checklist prior to returning to their sport

arm_group.arm_group_label: Utilization of a safe return to play checklist
arm_group.description: Athletes who were treated for a capsulolabral tear who have undergone arthroscopic capsulolabral repair surgery will be evaluated using an objective checklist prior to being allowed to return to their sport. The utilization and outcome of using this checklist will be evaluated

intervention.description: this objective checklist will be utilized by the physical therapy staff and surgeon to determine whether an athlete is safe to return to their sport
intervention.arm_group_label: Utilization of a safe return to play checklist

study_pop.textblock: All athletes undergoing arthroscopic capsulolabral repair surgery will be eligible for participation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and non-pregnant females aged 15 years or older with a capsulolabral tear undergoing arthroscopic capsulolabral repair surgery at the Rothman Institute with one of the investigators
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with an labral repair
- Patients only undergoing debridements with no repair
- Patients undergoing revision shoulder surgery or those with a history of multiple shoulder surgeries
- Concomitant severe glenohumeral arthritis or adhesive capsulitis
- Patients with a worker's compensation claim
- Patients diagnosed with psychological disorders
- Patients with a history of alcohol or drug abuse -Patients on preoperative narcotic therapy -

facility.name: Rothman Orthopaedics at Egg Harbor Township
